result.execSummary:
The defendant Courtney Lynn Sims was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes:
Provide DNA sample and pay DNA surcharge during probation; failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment being entered.
Pay all mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges during probation; failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment being entered.
Court waived all non-mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges finding the defendant indigent.

Complete an anger management class.
Complete a parenting class.
No corporal punishment of any children.

AODA assessment and cooperate with any treatment deemed necessary by the probation agent.
Absolute sobriety.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

records.addlTxt: Assessment for Attorney Fees in the amount of $990.00 entered as ordered by the court on 09/29/2022 to pay $75.00 monthly.  Final payment due by 12/01/2023. Failure to pay is a Civil Judgment.

filed.

Defendant Courtney Lynn Sims in court with attorney Kerri Terann Cleghorn.  Michelle A. Grasso appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
Defense is requesting a plea and sentencing hearing date.  Case is adjourned to 9-15-22 at 9:00 am for plea and sentencing in person in Room 504 of the Courthouse.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Courtney Lynn Sims in court with attorney Kerri Terann Cleghorn.  Jessica Ann Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Milwaukee Police Officer Jason Daering.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adourned to 8-17-22 at 8:30 am for scheduling conference  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court is reinstating Justice Point monitoring at the previous level with the same previous conditions.

The Preliminary Hearing scheduled for 7-15-22 at 9:30 am is rescheduled to 7-20-22 at 8:30 am by zoom.  The Court is down on 7-15-22 because there are no court reporters available.  All parties agreed upon new court date via email.

Defendant Courtney Lynn Sims in court.  Michelle A. Grasso appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Courtney Lynn Sims appeared by video means.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
OFF THE RECORD:  Defendant appeared by zoom.  Defense counsel is in trial in another court and is unable to appear for today's court date.  Case adjourned, Br. 10.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 15, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Justice Point Violation (DISCHARGE) Report received and filed.  Report forwarded to Judge for review.

Defendant Courtney Lynn Sims in court with attorney Kerri Terann Cleghorn.  Michelle A. Grasso appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Courtney Lynn Sims appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Status Conference held.  Defense counsel was recently appointed.  Court will schedule case for preliminary hearing.  Case adjourned, Br. 10.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint PreTrial Services Supervision Report dated May 20, 2022; received and filed.
signed and filed.

Defendant Courtney Lynn Sims in court.  Ann R. Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court conducted Indigency Hearing. Court held colloquy with defendant. Court found defendant is eligible for appointment of counsel by court. Defendant requested court appointed counsel and agreed to reimburse Milwaukee County for the expense. The court appointed Atty. Kerri Cleghorn, present  to represent defendant in this matter at County expense and at the rate of $100.00 per hour. The Court ordered the defendant repay the County at a rate of $75.00 per month beginning at the completion of the case, and then the 1st of each month there after. Court advised defendant failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.  Case is adjourned to 5-23-22 at 8:30 am for status conference.
  This hearing will be streamed live on DAcast:
https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d84cd54a-763c-3a58-15a9-b84acf306616  Status conference scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Courtney Lynn Sims in court with attorney Corey R. Flynn.  Defendant Courtney Lynn Sims in custody.  Owen M Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Courtney Lynn Sims appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Hearing held via zoom/DAcast.  Defendant has pending felony 21CF2573 assigned to Branch 40.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10 .  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS NOT INDIGENT AND NOT PUBLIC DEFENDER eligible.  Matter remains calendared in Branch 10.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
